 eb0223968761df405c16a4885fff36c2fd05e9d1

 7e2efdad75aad3c6d29c1d12717f2939bb5c1252
Author: Micha≈Ç Grzybowski <michal@grzybowscy.org>
Date:   Tue May 3 21:27:34 2022 +0200

    Issue #1515 Don't scroll blockwidget after toggling block visibility
    
    Before the change (as noted by
    https://github.com/LibreCAD/LibreCAD/issues/1515#issuecomment-1051356059),
    toggling block visibility caused it to scroll to the active
    block. Such behaviour is problematic especially for drawings with
    large number of blocks.
    
    It looks like blockwidget code assumed that QG_BlockWidget::update()
    would be called after every user interaction to maintain current
    scroll position. It turns out that toggling block visibility bypassed
    the update method - it was handled by slotActivated() and
    activateBlock() later on. To fix the problem, the activateBlock()
    method now also restores the scroll position. As it is called by
    update(), the scroll position handling in update() seems redundant and
    has been removed.

 d85ae40e1012a348f832542655e068f7cd8a1e92
Author: pollywinters <polly.winters@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 28 21:32:41 2022 +0100

    Issue #1519 No tooltips shown for widgets on the 'Categories' toolbar
    Solution:
    Tooltips are added by insertion of "setToolTip()" calls within the
    librecad/src/ui/lc_widgetfactory.cpp source file, function
    LC_WidgetFactory::createCategoriesToolbar().


 93447c1ba16ce10008a73c4b0b3d94eb52fe7517
Author: Adam Zimny <adamzimny@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Mar 13 16:50:04 2022 +0100

    Fix renaming of nested blocks
    
    Block list fix:
    When block A that is nested within block B is renamed, then rename
    also all inserts of block A withing block B in the blocklist.
    
    Entity container fix:
    RS_Insert is a subclass of RS_EntityContainer. Inserts within
    inserts (in entity tree of a graphic) should be renamed as well.
    
    Fixes issue #1527

 75154ffff6326255ee2300ab053ded5b89d5d60b
Author: Micha≈Ç Grzybowski <michal@grzybowscy.org>
Date:   Thu Jan 20 21:23:03 2022 +0100

    Issue #1515 Don't scroll layerwidget after toggling layer visibility
    
    Before the change, toggling layer visibility (or in essence updating
    contents of layerwidget) caused it to scroll to the active layer. Such
    behaviour is problematic especially for drawings with large number of
    layers.
    
    Fix is simple - don't set active layer during layerwidget update.

 18a0b3ff022f0398a9af3897eaf7c21cc4659639
Author: Glen Whitney <glen@studioinfinity.org>
Date:   Wed Jul 28 14:43:57 2021 -0700

    fix: increase maximum sizes of statusbar widgets to accommodate hidpi
      Since all of these widgets shrink to fit their content anyway, there is
      really no downside to larger maximum sizes, and they prevent the text
      content of the widgets from being clipped on hidpi displays.

 409e379fe54017539b1db757e94c29ffbc5373e4

    See 
 4a8b64c3ad1503c47059c78a30e1160ea371b748


 e1cb7f6c7bc1b110eb327956544dc7e253c8d0cc
Author: Petko Georgiev <petko.vas.georgiev@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 24 12:18:11 2020 +0200

    Remove useless operator=() for DRW_Coord
    
    See 
 4a8b64c3ad1503c47059c78a30e1160ea371b748


 61f52df76718085bb92c988f1fea1cf69f6db9b8
Author: Petko Georgiev <petko.vas.georgiev@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 24 11:58:30 2020 +0200

    Fix issues with DL_Extrusion
    
    DL_Extrusion used a dynamically allocated direction vector
    (which is always allocated to 3 elements) without providing
    a copy or move constructor. This is **obviously dangerous**.
    
    This 
 replaces the dynamically allocated vector with
    a statically allocated 3 element array. This simplifies the
    class as no constructor, destructor and operators have to be
    provided anymore and no memory has to be manually allocated.
    
    It also removes one of the getDirection() functions as it exposes
    the internal direction pointer. Also this function isn't used
    anywhere in LibreCAD, so no other code has to be modified.


 ad7b375bd39fe02a646bd554ccee2517362ad54b
Author: Petko Georgiev <petko.vas.georgiev@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 24 11:33:05 2020 +0200

    Remove useless operator=() for DL_Attributes
    
    As DL_Attributes itself does not use any dynamic memory,
    the default assignment operator will do the same job.
    
    GCC generates a warning when the default copy constructor is used
    for classes that have user-defined assignment operator. This is
    because such classes should implement their own copy contructor.
    This is obviously not needed for DL_Attributes.


 5fed3c66ff07eb9fea82489ca99cfdcd293b29e6
Author: Petko Georgiev <petko.vas.georgiev@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 24 10:32:13 2020 +0200

    Fix deprecated usage of QString::null
    
    This 
 replaces all usages of QString::null with QString()
    as the former has been deprecated since Qt5.9 and seems to be
    mostly unmentioned in the Qt documentation.


 b24e26a6b7911afe6d36be35051e48ceac2b496e
Author: Armin Stebich <home@mail.lordofbikes.de>
Date:   Mon Jun 1 14:13:08 2020 +0200

    fixed .travis.yml, applied new access token on Travis for static analyzer reports


 ce59dd5dc00e4b0d66ae4d29e4ccb8f60b374bd4
Author: Vyacheslav Tyrtov <v.tyrtov@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun May 31 18:52:18 2020 +0300

    libdxfrw: fix spline parsing
    
    Splines were parsed incorrectly when weight == 0 - fixed
    
    weight type was changed to int to print it correctly during debug
    (there is no DRW_dbg::print(unsigned char) and std::string was used)
    
    Signed-off-by: Vyacheslav Tyrtov <v.tyrtov@gmail.com>

 0729c80191fbc7cdf80c60eae21be6da7d939861
Author: Vyacheslav Tyrtov <v.tyrtov@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun May 31 13:58:02 2020 +0300

 f19f14000ad544c2ba7e2dea5240475fb38477a8
Author: irsbugs <irsbugs@hotmail.com>
Date:   Tue May 26 19:34:35 2020 +1200

    Update qg_commandedit.cpp
    
    qg_commandedit.cpp has `void QG_CommandEdit::readCommandFile(const QString& path)` function to read command files. There is no provision to add comments in a command file.
    
    This update allows lines commencing with a hash ( # ) to be treated as a comment and ignored from being passed to the `processInput(line)` function.

    This is the standard (AutoCAD like) behavior.

    printing A1 drawing on A4 paper in testing purposes, for example.

 a17f8281093403f0c7c36996232665ed21906688
Author: Chris Rendle-Short <chris@killred.net>
Date:   Fri Oct 25 12:02:23 2019 +1100

    Fix missing app name and icon on Wayland
    
    Wayland uses the .desktop file to find the app icon. Without it being specified the correct icon is not shown.
    
    Tested on Gnome/Wayland.
    
    References:
    
      - https://community.kde.org/Guidelines_and_HOWTOs/Wayland_Porting_Notes#Application_Icon
      - https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qguiapplication.html#desktopFileName-prop


 69a43e46206fb845ad8cd9a9cf117ecd93d0e779
Author: kordik <kordik@psyche4.it.cas.cz>
Date:   Thu Sep 26 12:25:40 2019 +0200

    When drawing a line by a mouse and holding the "Shift" key during
    placing the line endpoint, one can move the cursor only along certain
    angles (0¬∞, 15¬∞, 30¬∞, 45¬∞, etc.).
    This 
 enables this feature also for moving and copying entities.
    I. e. when the reference point is selected and the entity is moved, by
    pressing the "Shift" key one can move the reference point (and the
    entity) only along the certaing angles (0¬∞, 15¬∞, 30¬∞, 45¬∞, etc.)
    measured from the original reference point position.


 febeff7bd6e96e3f73e73be46a6faf22b4cbcd7d
Author: Glen Whitney <gwhitney@post.harvard.edu>
Date:   Sun Aug 11 22:28:51 2019 -0700

    Fix persistence of the angle in a MoveRotate operation
    
        Prior to this change, because of an inconsistency between
        librecad/src/ui/forms/qg_moverotateoptions.cpp using "MoveRotate" for
        the name of the settings holding the angle but
        librecad/src/ui/forms/qg_lg_moverotate.cpp using "MoveRotateAngle", the
        previously used value of this angle would not show up in the next
        invocation of the MoveRotate dialog; rather, it would always be 30 degrees.
    
        This 
 fixes this unhelpful behavior by conforming both files
        to use "MoveRotateAngle" as the name of the setting. Now the previously
        used value of the angle does show up in the next invocation of the dialog.


 cfc8ff50dd3656caa0d6b08646b454a3b76a456f
Author: Glen Whitney <gwhitney@post.harvard.edu>
Date:   Sun Aug 11 18:06:18 2019 -0700

    Make layout of the Divide plugin independent of pixel density
    
      Prior to this 
, the dialog for the Divide plugin contained
      numerous explicit specifications of the number of pixels to leave for
      various items. As a result, the dialog was unreadable to the point of
      being nearly unusable on displays with pixel densities outside the
      originally contemplated design range.
    
      This change removes all explicit geometry specifications
      in favor of using QLayout objects to construct the dialog and place all of
      the widgets. This way, the dialog can flexibly adapt to whatever display
      and fonts are being used.
    
      As a small side cleanup, this 
 resolved one confusion between the
      size and quantity fields, and made the labeling of these primary parameters
      clearer. Also, it removed the explicit calculation of where the error message
      box would be placed on screen, which was using deprecated Qt calls; the
      plugin should rely on Qt to do the right thing in terms of locating alert
      boxes.
    
      And finally, as an aid to understanding the code, this 
 removed
      the "magic numbers" in the call to dividedlg::choice in favor of a
      private enum so that the calls could be more self-documenting.


 10d502db66527ea64a2a012add2e57059e2409f0

 c1885ec5b7bac0ff83b6b65e7e0e72cb3705f32a

 91c8f4466ed3c0361d06d6f28cb51f741c9449a3

    SVG export changes/updates
     - renamed to Export as CAM/plain SVG;
     - MakerCAM option description, which originally was implemented as QLabel, replaced with ToolTips - to make it more similar to other UI/save space in dialog;

     - added baking of lines of all supported types (dot, dash, dashdot, etc) to used it in CAM's

 050f9e30f07e4286049d4e65782ee85697d1c3c0
Merge: edf15fe9 1fc9dd89
Author: Armin Stebich <github@lordofbikes.de>

    Merge pull request #967 from pwnage101/better_horizontal_dimensions
    
    Better inside-horizontal dimensions


 1fc9dd89a959b5191503d8508db2ca7e1287dd49
Author: Troy Sankey <sankeytms@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 17 17:04:07 2018 -0400

    Improve appearance of inside-horizontal dimensions
    
    * The monolithic method to calculate both inside-horizontal and
      aligned dimensions were broken into two separate methods since they
      became too different.  As a result, some calculations are duplicated,
      so there is still room for improvement.
    
    * Now, dimension text is never offset from the insertion point for
      inside-horizontal mode.  This would otherwise be a breaking change,
      but inside-horizontal was broken to begin with, so I would rather take
      this oppportunity to fix what I believe to be a bug.
    
    * getAlignText() was renamed to getInsideHorizontalText() because the
      method returns true when inside-horizontal mode is enabled, not when
      aligned mode is enabled.
    
    * A new helper function was added for calculating intersections between
      dimensionLine and text boxes.  This de-dupes some code.
    
    * A new method was added to RS_Line (getProjectionValueAlongLine) to get
      the projected value of a point along the line.  This is only used
      currently for sorting vector solutions of intersections.


 fbfb1a04fc094d4206974601f1c0d8588942fa6e
Author: Troy Sankey <sankeytms@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 20 19:02:11 2018 -0400

    fix code style, mostly removed mixed tabs and spaces
    
    This will help readability of the subsequent

 1d1f875c3ff497af1836560330a42ccef503d92c
Author: webmite <ianm.main@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 4 08:02:11 2017 -0500

    fix-new-layer-auto-numbering
    
    This allows for any base layer name with a suffix number to be auto
    incremented. If no name is supplied it reverts to the default base layer
    name of 'noname' and with any additional layers being provided a suffix
    number automatically. It is also possible to just use numbered layers
    with no base layer name and it will still auto increment correctly...the
    only exception being layer '0'. So if you want simple numbered layers
    click the + button then replace the default 'noname' layer name in the
    dialog with '1' and click 'OK'. From then on highlighting the layer you
    want to increment and clicking the '+' button will give you a new layer
    with the next available number above the one you just selected.

 457971d69c55a6182767945bc2e953b8d4a8b5dc
Author: Luis Colorado <luiscoloradourcola@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 27 20:49:07 2017 +0300

    Changed user interface
    
    It's more common to use addendum & dedendum parameters relative
    to the modulus (which is the amount the pitch_diameter grows
    as you add one tooth to your gear)
    
    As all standard conformed gears of same modulus are compatible,
    it's better to select the modulus and allow the program to calculate
    the right pitch diameter, as normally yo design gears to interconnect
    them, so better to select a modulus, then change the number of teeths
    only.
    
    So, I changed the pitch radius for the modulus, instead.
    
    I have taken the liberty to also add my name to the credits line.
    
    Signed-off-by: Luis Colorado <luiscoloradourcola@gmail.com>

 dc5f38690a69676d8af4973c470d88ad725d419b
Author: webmite <ianm.main@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 11 13:17:57 2017 -0400

    Fix for issue #884 -- Improve Current Drawing Preferences - Units tab
    upDateAnglePrecision referenced wrong comboBox


 8a18e58e9c417a0d121c61b4d7cecd461b59e0c0
Author: webmite <webmite@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 4 13:57:02 2017 -0400

    Update rs_math.cpp eval fn
    
    This allows for Imperial shorthand translation
    prior to the main parser evaluation.
    More user-friendly interface at the commandline
    as users can use shorthand in relative
    or absolute expressions.
    
    examples below.
    Eval 20'2"+10'11"3/4
    Eval (20*12+2)+(10*12+11+3/4)
    ----------------
    Eval 20'2"-10'11"3/4
    Eval (20*12+2)-(10*12+11+3/4)
    ----------------
    Eval -10'11"3/4
    Eval ()-(10*12+11+3/4)
    ----------------
    Eval 20'2"+10
    Eval (20*12+2)+(10)
    ----------------
    
    known issue:
    The conditional check of units currently looks at global preferences
    unit definition.  It should actually reference the units assigned
    to the current drawing.

 41a0ca515734724aa931a585bb7c98bba9194af4
Author: Equoda <Equoda@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 18 21:01:51 2016 +0300

    fix: Save after Undo does nothing; #803
    
    Added trigger ```graphic->setModified(true)``` in ```RS_ActionEditUndo::trigger()``` on "redo" action.
    
    This trigger must be added to any procedure that change draft, because "save/save as" action checks if document is modified.
    
    Changes to be 
ted:
        modified:   librecad/src/actions/rs_actioneditundo.cpp

 05980009e15b7e1606b35f51afbd96f7f8391096
Merge: 33d3989d 35a1a9e6
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>

 35a1a9e6fb8985993b3a8c3f1637d73331789794
Author: Scott Howard <showard314@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 4 20:32:45 2016 -0400

    Don't add /usr/include to INCLUDEPATH
    
    You get a build error with gcc 6 if /usr/include is in the INCLUDEPATH
    See:
    https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-53367
    https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=831189

 709f619eeb5d447f117d00bdf3adb9529c585dea

 cd52ce74faf2aa05b39a4a6083435a8a3b2061aa
Author: Ruben De Smet <ruben.de.smet@rubdos.be>
Date:   Mon Jun 20 13:03:50 2016 +0200

    Caches the value of QScrollBar::sizeHint().
    
    This method got called each time the window was drawn. This leads to a
    chain of calls into the underlying windowing system (even into GTK, on
    my machine). It took ~57% of an RS_Line::draw call.
    
    Now the value gets cached, and the resizeEvent in QScrollBar is used to
    update the cached value.


 6016e8de100e95c1e5aa4dc1bffc888337253514

 9e01199c8dd77a0b484092713f2756c6c35f3092

 0e167183241bfbed8aa146f5258f57f1f2d9a205
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sat Jun 18 23:30:43 2016 -0700

    improved performance by limiting entity processing; #727
    
    & ensured that the viewport rectangle is only created once,
    instead of for every line


 9b28c11331a05cff4cebb389ce39f16153ab30df
Author: Ruben De Smet <ruben.de.smet@rubdos.be>
Date:   Sat Jun 18 17:08:30 2016 +0200

    Fix: limit scrolling to drawing + perimeter.
    
    Before this patch, the scroll limits were arbitrary, which
    made the user have to use zoom to recenter the scroll perimeter,
    in order to navigate the whole document.
    
    This patch limits scrolling to the drawing instead. The exact perimeters
    are now so that the drawing is always in the viewport, with an extra
    empty zone of 75% for potentially extending the drawing.
    
    This issue got mentioned in #479


 1f862ff29d3b7e394a404fc04386da5179d3a099
Author: Ruben De Smet <ruben.de.smet@rubdos.be>
Date:   Sat Jun 18 15:31:41 2016 +0200

    Fix for Trackpads without smooth/hi-res scrolling.
    
    Trackpads that did not have hi-res scrolling fell back on the
    default (mouse) behaviour. This makes behaviour inconsistent between
    machines (or even DE's: Gnome X.org has hi-res, Gnome Wayland+XWayland
    does not).
    
    This patch assumes that if
      options->device == "Trackpad"
      and
      no smooth scrolling
    the "scroll wheel" (QWheelEvent::angleDelta()) is used instead of
    the "trackpad" (QWheelEvent::pixelDelta()).
    
    Division by four is an arbitrary constant to make a compromise
    between smooth scrolling and scrolling too fast.
    
    This patch makes working with LibreCAD under XWayland the same
    experience as under X.org afaik. More work is needed for native
    Wayland (librecad -platform wayland) support.


 9fe120f1fc00f27f3347f5b9ceda06f223af4319
Author: Ruben De Smet <ruben.de.smet@rubdos.be>
Date:   Sat Jun 18 15:02:27 2016 +0200

    Fix wrong identation in qggraphicview.cpp


 08633c8713e237be93eceefa8db959fd095def56
Author: Equoda <Equoda@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 17 15:14:49 2016 +0300

    fix:  Pasted blocks in Block List widget do not contain proper hatch data; #760

 d730254350bf478afd8630c80eac69c01429786d
Author: Equoda <Equoda@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 3 18:38:47 2016 +0300

    Committer: Equoda <Equoda@users.noreply.github.com>
    
    fix: wrong dimension format when removing trailing zeroes
    
    Solve the removing integer part of dimension problem. Decimal sparator was ignored.
    Changes are in ```librecad/src/lib/engine/rs_dimension.cpp```. ```RS_Dimension::stripZerosLinear``` fuction has been rewritten.
    
    Closes #725

 55ea7b71ff2618ac50ff48e3765087ddae2a8dc3
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 3 01:29:05 2016 -0700

    ensured all actions are killed before subwindow closes; #733
    
    & allowed for using tools in the print preview again
    
    & ensured subwindows are closed before the object tree destruction
    The dialogfactory is deleted in ~QC_ApplicationWindow;
    therefore, if it's accessed in a subwindow's destructor,
    there will be a crash.

 1d63744790a327c5b16d152b10ec80ade4ea20b8
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 21 18:28:11 2016 -0700

    tweaked rs_graphicview / qg_graphicview
    
    - moved and renamed set_action (setCurrentQAction)
    - switched to qDeleteAll (recommended by Qt pro)
    - removed unique_ptr from eventhandler  (already part of the object
    tree)
    
    Two memory management systems is not better than one. Prefer the object
    tree for QObjects.
    http://doc.qt.io/qt-4.8/objecttrees.html

 84aa7241cc54426f2ca0f4d78d8ba31580997f25
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 14 21:47:04 2016 -0700

    removed unused help manual code
    
    This simplifies the build process, and eliminates 4 Qt frameworks and 6
    Qt plugins.
    
    The help manual has not been used in 5 years,
    and maintaining / translating html documentation is not a realistic
    goal.
    
    Wiki articles are easier to contribute to, and we can make PDF files
    for offline documentation.

 fe109928dff4b2a1ec433d12440a8ae3717b4981

 33a1561ea251a35d8cbf46cb5f9ed2e54efd0685
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 23 14:08:28 2016 -0800

    added ComboBoxOption and applied it to Device Options
    
    ComboBoxOption can be reused, and emits the selected option when the
    Set button is pressed. The Set button is designed to be disabled
    automatically when the last saved option is selected. In other words
    users can‚Äôt save the same value twice in a row. Using a Set button for
    each option avoids saving options unnecessarily.
    
    LC_Options is used to automatically update all open graphicviews
    without having to loop through them.
    
    I made a version that sets the option (by making option->device a
    reference member), thereby avoiding signals and slots; however, this
    made the class more confusing.

 4260dd6d576e7c095815cb3e3914c583e7023bfc
Author: Krzysztof Foltman <wdev@foltman.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 11 22:58:04 2016 +0000

    issue #644, bug476: invert the logic to make both trimmed and non-trimmed version work
    
    This only applies to non-polyline rounded corners. Before the fix, two problems occur:
    
    1. Without 'trim' enabled, the original lines were deleted
    2. With 'trim' enabled, the original lines were NOT deleted
    3. With 'trim' enabled, the undo operation was broken (the trimmed segments
    survived undo)
    
    Inverting the trim part of the condition seems to fix all three.

 b1564c543b3be16e6caef3417d99c2fd8790e85e
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 9 19:18:37 2016 -0800

    removed devicePixelRatio from pen toolbar
    
    This was producing a lot of extra space to the right of the toolbar
    that could not be removed by resizing (on OS X 10.11.3 with a retina
    display).
    The toolbar is perfectly sized after removing this code.
    
    I recommend allowing widgets to be automatically sized for optimal
    cross platform results. If it can‚Äôt be achieved that way, then the
    widget likely needs to be redesigned.

 f100ad9ceb732051c4cabd340a7c9d3646a8c7c6
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 5 11:32:19 2016 -0800

    ensured plugin exit when switching tools and on program exit; issue #596


 7b4d123d353d6ed9e0008b29756ae09bf1790c40
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 5 11:11:01 2016 -0800

    ensured plugin exit on right-click; issue #596
    
    QC_ActionGetEnt::getSelected was always returned a non-null pointer;
    therefore, `if (!ent) return` in sameprop.cpp was never returning and
    continued on to getSelect where it would get caught in the while loop.
    
    The mouse events of qc_actiongetent, qc_actiongetselect and
    qc_actiongetpoint were not setting completed = true; therefore,
    right-click was not exiting the associated while loops
    
    + some other tweaking... more information will soon be presented in
    issue #596

 42dc902b647f20bc0b5ff162ba72b9346f5c0a5c

    improved & moved statusbar font size option; issue #638

    status bar to be affected by status_bar->setFont()

    with the statusbar on first load.

    cramped.

 d0a489be647bfb5f4185f753780232df283c6f96
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sat Jan 23 16:41:26 2016 -0800

    simplified splash screen code
    
    - I could not find a valid reason for using #ifdef QSPLASHSCREEN_H
    - The splash variable is now recognized by Qt Creator.
    - Reimplementing QMainWindow::show() for using QTimer::singleShot is
    unnecessary, and makes the splash screen dependent on it.
    
    The splash screen is designed to indicate that the program is loading
    prior to the display of the main window; and it is designed to be closed
    via splash->finish(main_window).
    
    This is prep-work for a "Start with main window maximized" option
    (coming soon).

 31c6ac088e538a0f60381e3e2c4576f820cd3d33
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 5 00:27:08 2016 -0800

    added style sheet option; issue #628
    
    & removed menu text size option in favor of adding QMenu {font-size:
    16px} to a custom style sheet
    
    & removed the check for the current style... it was overly complicated
    and the style className is changed to "StyleSheet" if one has been set
    via qApp
    
    This unlocks the awesome power of style sheets!
    You can name your file whatever you want (e.g. style_sheet.txt)
    http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/stylesheet.html

 40408e8b6b333e9d404cf23d64e57849f05f96ee
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sat Jan 2 11:40:18 2016 -0800

    added widget options dialog & menu text size option
    
    This demonstrates a different approach to an options dialog.
    The dialog itself does nothing;
    everything is located in QC_ApplicationWindow::widgetOptionsDialog
    which eliminates having to read the settings directly after writing
    them.
    
    I acknowledge that rs_settings takes care of qvariant conversion and
    uses a cache map;
    however, I want to write this as modular as possible for now.
    
    The values passed to QCoreApplication::setOrganizationName and
    QCoreApplication::setApplicationName are remembered by qsettings.
    
    Segregating the widget options makes it more modular for other projects;
    and it causes the window to load faster.
    
    I will add the statusbar height and text size option soon.

 0aafd518b86815d296bbc49b5f95ef2d6312517d
Author: Robert Hailey <rhailey@allogy.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 8 12:11:22 2015 -0600

    Better zoom-field navigation through basic ZUI "flight" theory
    
    When scrolling with the mouse wheel, you should find:
    + Far less "inch worming" (e.g. mouse top-left, zoom in, mouse bottom-right, zoom out)
    + Zooming out tends to reveal more logical/useful canvas
    + Zooming in tends to center objects that were under the cursor
    + Zooming in on objects near the edge of the view port should now be in a useful position more often
    - Seasoned veterans might need to get used to the "drift" or "not working around the old zoom mechanic".
    - Not as effective for "just playing with the grid lines" [i.e. zoom_in != inverse(zoom_out)]
    
    Relatedly:
    - Zooming is still a bit too choppy, IMO.
    - Snapper/Guides are still not redrawn after a zoom event.


 ce8fd41a8a3a2c27bec25c9c24e2c42f5f279c9c
Author: Dongxu Li <dongxuli2011@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 12 00:50:38 2015 -0500

    vector: use LC_Rect
    
    removed API VectorSolutions::clean(), use member function clear()
    instead

 09f996dd731af74a78a226692e17097d5b6a8131
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 7 23:46:23 2015 -0800

    changed default widget layout to consider non-widescreens
    
    The left sidebar (tool dockwidgets) increases the program's minimum
    height; and it doesn't leave much drawing space on a non-widescreen. I
    might make an action for toggling all of them as a group.
    
    The pen and option toolbars work well together; the option toolbar has
    plenty of room to display anything it needs to, and the pen widget is
    slightly shorter than regular toolbars, which makes the "line" that they
    are on shorter than the others.

 40d972952e14f3b91c9034f0655eb267f9344794
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Tue Oct 27 17:30:01 2015 -0700

    removed check for current window in closeEvent
    
    mdiAreaCAD->currentSubWindow() was returning a window,
    possibly because mdiAreaCAD->closeAllSubWindows()
    is not finalized until the function returns to the event loop.
    It is redundant anyhow; the subwindows will be deleted when the main
    window is.
    
    The check if(mdiAreaCAD==nullptr) will never return true.

 1eeaf081020c8022ff0df72ebc72b3df2def85e3
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sun Oct 25 11:45:14 2015 -0700

    made QC_MDIWindow a subclass of QMdiSubWindow
    
    Maybe using QMainWindow was the proper choice before Qt 4.3;
    however, it needlessly adds another layer now that QMdiSubWindow exists.
    Where it was QMdiArea -> QMdiSubWindow -> QC_MdiWindow -> QG_GraphicView
    it is now QMdiArea -> QC_MdiWindow -> QG_GraphicView
    
    QC_MdiWindow inherits QMdiSubWindow::mdiArea() and a couple signals and
    slots that are possibly more useful than those provided by QMainWindow.

 9186d5d8f4b20fb65237a598919bf4dace873282
Author: ravas <ravas@outlook.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 24 16:06:43 2015 -0700

    added QC_ApplicationWindow to the stack & improved destructors and object tree
    
    - every example in the Qt documentation uses the stack for the top level
    QMainWindow
    - helpEngine and helpWindow are part of the object tree and will be
    deleted when their parent is
    - QG_MainWindowInterface is not necessary, the dialog factory can be
    made a subclass of QObject
    - added QG_RecentFiles to the object tree
    - the code removed from ~QC_MDIWindow() doesn't seem to make sense;
    it's trying to do things the QMdiArea is responsible for; everything
    seems to work fine without it.

 1a950ba477d4cc330b79ecdbfbc0ad1bbdaacd48
Author: ravas <his_self@live.com>
Date:   Sat Sep 26 11:30:43 2015 -0700

    replaced clear button with context entry and moved prompt up

    command line.
    The clear button was producing a minimum width;
    a context menu entry and the clear command seem adequate.
    The prompt label being on its own line allows for a wider input;
    and it also prevents the label from distorting the command widget's
    width.

 c1d9c3b0c7d929b812c935ffc23efe94a2537fbd
Author: Jerry <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Wed Sep 16 16:18:19 2015 +0200

    Fixed conflict in rs_commands.cpp


 684ab789609667c990c6142c03b8e7978043e6bb
Author: Rupicapra-rupicapra <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Wed Sep 16 16:14:13 2015 +0200

    Added help tip, shortcut command & corrected bug
    
    Help tip : when in mode "circle with center and radius", typing "radius"
    in the command-line allow the user to set the radius without moving
    hands off the keyboard, but the helper message didn't mentionned that
    possibility.
    
    Bug :¬†when setting radius from commandline, pressing enter to validate
    causes LibreCAD to draw a circle of selected radius at relative zero
    position (if no mouse activity into the container) or crosshair
    position (if mouse activity into the container).
    I added a `switch` test to the `trigger()` method to test the mode, and
    if the user is in mode "SetRadius", circle is not drawn & relative zero
    is not moved.
    
    Command shortcuts: `circlecr` and `cc`
    
    Conflicts:
            librecad/src/cmd/rs_commands.cpp

 29fefa11f20195aaec7f2169971752636459d75e
Author: Jerry Magnin <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Sat Sep 5 20:01:02 2015 +0200

    Fixed bug in autocompletion
    
    When pressing tab multiple times, the command in prompt was completed
    letter by letter to display the shortest command available from first
    input.
    It's now fixed :
    In such a case, 'mid' (the middle mark of the algorithm) was
    systematically one letter higher than 'low' (lowest branch of alg)
    because of the number of characters in the shortest command available
    (odd number of letters).
    On the other side, when the word contains a even number of letters,
    'mid' is given 'low' value before exiting the while loop.
    So, we can use 'low' as the mark for the left() function.


 087d9063b44a7d787e0eb6283b605ae6f96b4c24
Author: Jerry Magnin <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Sat Sep 5 14:49:52 2015 +0200

 07e447b43b15c42954f3bccd2f776cf49c7b9468
Author: Jerry Magnin <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Sat Sep 5 11:10:28 2015 +0200

    Packed extended autocompletion into a method
    
    This new private method returns the value of the common root, but does
    not changes the content of the prompt (I left it to tabPressed slot).
    This method is set private 'by default', as it does not needs to be
    called from the outside of the command-line.
    
            modifi√©¬†:         librecad/src/ui/forms/qg_commandwidget.cpp
            modifi√©¬†:         librecad/src/ui/forms/qg_commandwidget.h


 51eaed042c2eff1c1af9a78243fcfce270e30315
Author: Jerry <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Fri Sep 4 19:40:01 2015 +0200

    Minor cleanup in code


 c44a05dbda59bdcc160c95402331542217112532
Author: Jerry Magnin <dev@montagnisme.fr>
Date:   Fri Sep 4 18:09:50 2015 +0200

    Extended commandline autocompletion
    Commandline mimics bash autocompletion
    When an input may lead to at least 2 valid commands, if these commands
    have the same root, pressing <tab> will put that root into input line.
    Example : typing 'di <tab>' will prompt 'dim', as 'dim' is the common
    root for all commands starting by 'di'.
    It mimics bash autocompletion behavior.
    
    Later, I‚Äôll try to implement zsh behavior (first press on <tab> prompts
    the common root, next presses prompts possible commands one after
    another).
    
            modifi√©¬†:         librecad/src/ui/forms/qg_commandwidget.cpp

    updated opengost fonts by stranger573
    
    Change log:
     Wed Dec 03 2014 stranger573 <stranger573@mail.ru>
     New version 1.1
      All font glyphs in the X-axis offset to zero for the correct alignment in
      the middle.
      In the lc_opengost-ar font changed Oslash (U+00D8) and oslash (U+00F8)
      glyphs to conform the overall style of the font.
      In the lc_opengost-br font added glyphs that were previously only to lc_opengost-ar.
      Added OE (U+0152) and oe (U+0153) ligatures.
      Added czech, hungarian, polish, romanian and slovak glyphs.
      Sun Nov 09 2014 stranger573 <stranger573@mail.ru>
      Initial Release. Version fonts 1.0

    Enable smooth scrolling and zooming on platforms that supports this

    of scroll vs modifier-scroll events and make use of the high-resolution

    that support this for QT >= 5.2. (I.e. pinch zoom on Mac)

 a61350ec6f37673a4e611152588c026b92c87e88
Author: thomas <thomas@thpc.(none)>
Date:   Sat Dec 28 18:14:28 2013 +0100

    Misc changes concerning keyboard shortcuts:
    
    * Added 2 letter shortcuts for restrict horizontal (rh), vertical (rv),
      orthogonal (rr) and none (rn).
    
    * In my opinion, the two-letter shortcuts for snapping and restricting
      should toggle and not just enable the corresponding function.
      Otherwise they can't be switched off with the shortcut. Changed the
      behaviour to toggle.
    
    * actionHandler->keycode() should only be called in keyPressEvent,
      if there are really two letters in the buffer. Otherwise the
      double-letter shortcuts get mixed up with single letter short commands
      which start with the same letter (e.g. 'os' and 'o' will be mixed up if
      the user tries to type 'os' multiple times without waiting the timeout),
      because we violate the fano-condition. Fixed that.
        Note: This changes the user interface behaviour somewhat, because only
        two letter commands (and the newly implemented shortcuts mentioned below)
        now work. It is not valid to just type 'o' for offset anymore. But I think
        this change is justified, because the old behaviour gave inconsistent
        results.
    
    * Added the possibility to assign actions to the function keys
      (F1, F2, ...) and key combination of "Alt" plus some key and "Meta"
      plus some key. Please note that Alt-keystrokes may interfere with
      the menu and GUI hotkeys.
    
      To use this feature, add an alias from e.g. Fn1, Alt-j or Meta-n
      to your desired function in your librecad.alias file (where '1', 'j'
      and 'n' are just examples here).
    
      Examples:
      To use F2 for lines, Alt-j for circles and Meta-x for 'extend' add:
      Fn2   line
      Alt-j circle
      Meta-x        xt
    
      to your alias file. Notice that the Alt- and Meta-modifiers respect
      are case sensitive. You may use different commands for upper- and lowercase
      letters here.
    
      Implementation details:
      The event handler keyPressEvent detects the modifier keys. If a key
      combination e.g. Meta-x. is pressed, the command string of the x key is
      just prefixed with the String "Meta-", resulting in "Meta-x". This way,
      no changes in the key processing code was needed to make this work.
      Side Effect: Typing "Meta-x" in the command line has the same Effect as
      pressing Meta+x.

 8c1326b51417e7b79c77b7bde373d62209a0ed86
Author: smallfix <you@example.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 6 21:27:52 2013 +0100

    hatch: intersection is not counted
    
    Intersection with a start-/end point of a line of a contour with
    an angle > pi is not counted (variable counter is not incremented).
    For testing use file: https://github.com/smallfix/librecadbugfiles/blob/master/hatch/contour_counter.dxf
    and the hatch pattern "hound".

 3a571369ce0a51a5f3e4cf5ab25c2def2d773333
Author: Erik Pagel <boxyaccount@web.de>
Date:   Wed May 2 20:55:39 2012 +0200

    Feature layer list filter by reg-expression is completed
    
    Now the layer list is always updated after
      changing reg-expression
      adding a new layer
      editing a layer
      removing a layer
    
    New for adding layer:
    
    New layer name is the last selected layer with an additional number
    If there was only layer "0" the new layer is initialized to "noname"
    Every new layer name is now selected, because of it's very easy to enter
    a complete different name or editing the submitted name.

 bb6eb3381d2b766e4d6764debf42fc436070ea60
Author: Erik Pagel <boxyaccount@web.de>
Date:   Sat Apr 28 11:21:04 2012 +0200

    new feature; layer list filter
    
    Now in the window layer list you are able to filter the listed layers,
    by input a reg-expression into the lineEdit object. Every changing
    inside the lineEdit will renew the layer list.
    
    The buttons hide and show all layers now have only affect to the shown
    layers in the list box.
    
    Known bugs:
    
    At the moment editing, removing and adding a layer are not able to renew
    the layer list box.
    
    
    Workaround:
    
    After using one of this option you have to change the reg-expression for
    a renew.
    
    
    Planed issue:
    
    To solve this problem I plan to add the QG_LayerModel class
    to the RS_LayerList class.

 b47147b9421a8f39a09c741ed6cd4c3d239e7869
Author: Daniel <dan@sstrev.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 30 01:31:12 2012 -0400

    SaveAs Dialog fixes: QG_FileDialog
    This patch first removes an unnecessary break in the function QG_FileDialog::getExtension
    The second part reworks most of the function QG_FileDialog::getSaveFile in order to give a
      default name of Untitled (where an incrementing # is added if Untitled already exists).
      This consequently stops the last folder from being selected as the new saveas file.
